Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RNase 6 R66Q Polymorphism (Ribonuclease 6; Ribonuclease family, antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; human; primates, mammals, animals; UCSS1a; 4S=S)

Literature.Author: Anguita R, Prats-Ejarque G, Moussaoui M, Becknell B, Boix E. 2024
Literature.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2024 Jan 3;25(1):604. doi: 10.3390/ijms25010604.PubMed
Literature.Title: A Common Polymorphism in RNASE6 Impacts Its Antimicrobial Activity toward Uropathogenic Escherichia coli.

Sequence Information.Comments: AMP significance: A common polymorphism in RNASE6 compromises Its antimicrobial activity toward uropathogenic E. coli.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (99.21%) toRNase 6L: 36%; K: 36%.Activity: this single-residue variant (MBC75 8.22 uM) is less active against E. coli than the WT (MBC75 2.08 uM). MBC100 > 20 uM against other strains.SAR: This variant also has reduced antibacterial activity (e.g., E. coli), LPS binding and bacteria-agglutinating ability compared to the WT with an arginine at position 66 (MAC 1.38 uM; cf. WT 0.22 uM). MAC=minimal agglutination concentration. In contrast, this change did not harm catalytic activity.Est.Jan2024;
